page.title: 01North St.Helens
page.content: Our D block covers the north of St.Helens,a metropolitan borough in the county of{Merseyside.}The area is made up of parts of the parishes{ {Rainford,Moss Bank,Windle and {Eccleston }and is divided by the East Lancashire Road (A580)into mainly arable farmland to the north and residential areas to the south.The valley of the {Rainford Brook}divides the block diagonally from{NE}to{SW} with{Crank Hill}rising to{90metres}to the north and smaller hills to the south.Glass making and the disribution of glass are the main industries in our block but many people travel to Liverpool and Manchester to work.Much of the housing is new with lots of recreation areas.The{northern}part of the area is dominated by arable farming with plenty of open fields,with few hedges.
